licence_overview:
$!Get a licence if you use a site for public entertainment.$!

##Exemptions

You may not need a licence for some events or sites, like:

* athletic events at sports grounds
* if you're a school, college or other educational institute
* if you already hold a theatre or cinema licence

Your council will have a full list of what they class as entertainment.

##How to apply

Contact your council to apply for a public entertainment licence.

^Your council may charge you an application fee.^

##Displaying your licence

Your council will tell you how to display your licence.

##Fines and penalties

You can be fined up to £20,000 if you use a site for public entertainment without a licence.
licence_short_description: A public entertainment licence is required if your site stages public entertainment.
